txt: Hi Caroline! I saw your profile on LinkedIn and I saw that you are working in a cybersecurity company! How was the job? And how hard was it to get it?
Hiiii Antiqua, I forgot to update my profile, I'm sorry. I don't work in CyberSec4Us anymore.
Oh, that's a pity. Are you the victim of the recent layoff wave?
Oh, that's a pity. But can you tell me something more about the job? How was it? How was the recruitment process?
Eh, the info did spread, didn't it... Indeed, Segfaultland's special forces raided our company.
Whaaaat? How could that happen? What about workers' rights?
What? The news only told about the layoff wave... Suspicious. Anyways, why the special forces had to intervene?
It was stressful, because Webvestee was actively trying to disrupt our greatest efforts. They have a LOT of hackers in there. I didn't even know that they train so many computer scientists :/
They gave us a large check each and told us to leave the company and never come back. I barely know what happened. I heard a few gossips, and they are not favorable...
Well I am soon to join the workforce and I consider being a cybersecurity specialist. That's why I texted you, didn't I? What were you doing there on a daily basis?
And the recruitment? What did you have to know?
Oh, the news only said something about the layoff wave, but didn't say anything about the special forces? Oh no. I'm afraid we have to stop this convo
Can't you just share a little?
Well, possibly the government doesn't want us to know. But let's get back to the topic. How hard was the job to get?
Sorry, but the special forces really scared me. I've signed an NDA, I can't say anything.
Okay, okay. But you can share what were your daily tasks in your job? I am truly curious.
What gossips? Can you just share a little?
I was a part of the so called 'Blue Team'. We were securing several companies against attacks. The worst part were the night shifts in the beginning :/
That's a shame. At least they didn't leave you empty-handed. But let's get back to the topic. How hard was the job to get?
But you got used to it, didn't you? What attacks did you face?
I had to know really basic things, for example what is a computer virus, what is unpacking, what tools does a cybersecurity analyst use.. All of it is extremely interesting and easy to learn.
And they didn't ask you about any of the exploits or potential attacks that you may face?

What I heard is... Shocking. Our company POSSIBLY was conspiring against the gov and working with the worst hackers from Reverseland. I have heard it from an unsure source, so it may not be true. If it is, then... I'm really ashamed of my company
Well I was interested in cybersecurity for a long time and I competed in various ctfs. You should give it a try. But still, it was hard. But doable.
That's... awful. Truly awful. Well I hope it doesn't affect your future recruitment in any way... Do you have any suspects?
Thx... I don't. It was a huge company. Let's stop talking about this, please
I hope the possibility is low and you will not be affected or discouraged by any of this. Who could on earth do that? Do you have the slightest idea?
Oh I know it too. Weren't there any more sophisticated questions?
The most funny one was a bank with an sql injection vulnerability XD But it was a looooong time ago. Incredibly funny.
Hmmm, that might be a great idea. I hope they won't be too easy for me! What should one know while competing in a ctf?
I don't know anything. I don't have any suspects. I won't talk about it anymore, I'm sorry
I sure will try. And what was your daily routine while working?
That's a true screw-up! Or as one might say, sql-up *ba dum tss*. Any other funny situations, or exploits?
A SQL injection? Like with a syringe? How does that work?
Okay, okay. How hard was the job to get then?
Okay. Let's get back on track. What were you doing there on a daily basis?
What attacks were you securing the companies against?
You have to know basics of cryptograhy, forensics, reverse engineering, websecurity... And you'll score a lot of podiums ;D
Thanks for disclosure :) Do you have any reliable sources to learn from? The books I read can be quite boring...
I sure will! But first, I need a reliable source to learn from. Do you know any?
Search for hacking wiki. Or use the HackInfo.rl forum
Can't tell you
Thank you very much! I hope we meet someday, whether itâ€™s at work or at a conference :D
Hah, I hope so too. Bye
Okay, okay... But can you tell me how does the SQL-injection work?
SQL injection, XSS for example
They also asked me what's SQL injection or XSS

So basically you can enter a SQL query into a input box on a website, and if it isn't protected against that, you can steal, change or delete data from their database. But of course, you should do that just for educational purposes ;) And do you know about XSS?
What's XSS? Some kind of variation on XD emoji?

Oh, it's not an emoji. The 'XSS' stands for Cross-Site Scripting. When you know that website runs scripts in others' browsers, you can sneak a malicious script! In that way you can get one's login information, or steal their token, or basically, mess with what they see on the page. Remember... only for educational purposes. I don't want to be waken up by special forces when it's 3 am!
They couldn't tell me in advance what I'll be doing haha. But they asked me what's SQL injection or XSS
Ok. And can you tell me something more about an SQL injection?

So basically you can enter a SQL query into a input box on a website, and if it isn't protected against that, you can steal, change or delete data from their database. But of course, you should do that just for educational purposes ;)
No, i don't know about XSS. Is this a variation on 'XD' emoji?

Oh, it's not an emoji. The 'XSS' stands for Cross-Site Scripting. When you know that website runs scripts in others' browsers, you can sneak a malicious script! In that way you can get one's login information, or steal their token, or basically, mess with what they see on the page. Remember... only for educational purposes. I don't want to be waken up by special forces when it's 3 am!
Thank you so much!! That's some valuable knowledge. Do you have any reliable sources? Because the books I read can be quite boring...
